title: World Capitals
description: How well do you know the capital cities of countries around the world?

questions.question: What is the capital city of France?
questions.explanation: Paris has been the capital of France since the 10th century. Known as the 'City of Light,' it is home to the Eiffel Tower and the Louvre.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Japan?
questions.explanation: Tokyo became Japan's capital in 1868 when the emperor moved there from Kyoto. It is the most populous metropolitan area in the world.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Australia?
questions.explanation: Canberra was purpose-built as the capital in 1913 because Sydney and Melbourne could not agree on which city should hold the title.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Brazil?
questions.explanation: Brasília replaced Rio de Janeiro as the capital in 1960. It was designed by architect Oscar Niemeyer and urban planner Lúcio Costa.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Egypt?
questions.explanation: Cairo is the largest city in Africa and the Arab world. It sits along the Nile River, near the ancient pyramids of Giza.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Canada?
questions.explanation: Ottawa was chosen as the capital by Queen Victoria in 1857. Many people mistakenly think Toronto or Montreal is the capital.

questions.question: What is the capital city of India?
questions.explanation: New Delhi was inaugurated as India's capital in 1931, replacing Calcutta. It was designed by British architects Edwin Lutyens and Herbert Baker.

questions.question: What is the capital city of South Korea?
questions.explanation: Seoul has been the capital of Korea for over 600 years since the Joseon Dynasty. Its name means 'capital' in Korean.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Argentina?
questions.explanation: Buenos Aires means 'good airs' or 'fair winds' in Spanish. It is often called the 'Paris of South America' for its European-style architecture.

questions.question: What is the capital city of South Africa's executive branch?
questions.explanation: South Africa uniquely has three capitals: Pretoria (executive), Cape Town (legislative), and Bloemfontein (judicial).

questions.question: What is the capital city of Thailand?
questions.explanation: Bangkok's full ceremonial name is the longest city name in the world at 168 letters! Locals often call it 'Krung Thep,' meaning 'City of Angels.'

questions.question: What is the capital city of Norway?
questions.explanation: Oslo has been Norway's capital since 1814. It was known as Christiania from 1624 to 1925 before reverting to its original Viking-era name.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Turkey?
questions.explanation: Ankara became Turkey's capital in 1923 when the Republic was founded by Atatürk. Istanbul, though larger, serves as the cultural and economic hub.

questions.question: What is the capital city of New Zealand?
questions.explanation: Wellington became New Zealand's capital in 1865 due to its central location. It is the world's southernmost capital of a sovereign state.

questions.question: What is the capital city of Peru?
questions.explanation: Lima was founded by Spanish conquistador Francisco Pizarro in 1535. It is home to one of the oldest universities in the Americas, founded in 1551.
